document.docAuthor: Antić, Dragan, Dražina, Tvrtko, Raða, Tonći, Tomić, Vladimir T. & Makarov, Slobodan E.
document.docTitle: Egonpretneria vudutschajldi Antic and Drazina, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: Review of the family Anthogonidae (Diplopoda, Chordeumatida), with descriptions of three new species from the Balkan Peninsula

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the family Anthogonidae (Diplopoda, Chordeumatida), with descriptions of three new species from the Balkan Peninsula

heading.emphasis:
Egonpretneria vudutschajldi Antić and Dražina
, sp. n.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined. Holotype male: Vudu Čajld Pit, Vršeljci, Middle Velebit, Velebit Mountains, Croatia ,
44 ° 40 ' 36.28 "N
,
15 ° 6 ' 22.52 "E
, 1060 m ,
29 .VII. 2012
, leg. A. Kirin ( CBSS , DIP 338 b). Paratype male I: same data as for holotype (IZB ANG EV 100 – 1 ). Paratype male II: Rođakuša Pit, Lomska Duliba, North Velebit, Velebit Mountains, Croatia ,
44 ° 46 ' 18.62 "N
,
15 ° 2 ' 12.98 "E
, 1322 m ,
16 .VIII. 2014
, leg. T. Rađa (IZB ANG EV 100 – 2 ).

Diagnosis. The new species differs clearly from
E. brachychaeta
in numerous aspects of the anterior and posterior gonopods, including a high syncoxal medial rounded lobe coalesced basally with the rest of the gonopods, without a basal opening; robust lateral processes; and the presence of a medial sternal process much lower than the lateral coxal processes on the posterior gonopods.

Measurements : Holotype male 11.8 mm long, vertical diameter of its largest pleurotergite 1 mm ; paratype male I 12.5 mm long, vertical diameter of its largest pleurotergite 1.05 mm ; paratype male II 11.25 mm long, vertical diameter of its largest pleurotergite 0.9 mm .
Collum: Narrower than head, with six macrochaetae. Anterior side semicircular, posterior side slightly concave.

Telson : Epiproct with a pair of spinnerets and six setae arranged in two rows ( 2 + 2 marginal trichoid setae and 1 + 1 paramedial bacilliform setae). Hypoproct with two apical trichoid setae. Paraprocts with 3 + 3 marginal trichoid setae and protruding base.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–8.
Egonpretneria vudutschajldi
sp. n.
, paratype male from the Rođakuša Pit, Velebit Mt. 1: body segments XV and XVI, dorsal view; 2: body segment XV, dorsal view; 3: body segment XVI, dorsal view; 4: limbus of body segment XVI; 5: cross-section of body segment XVI, posterior view; 6: external macrochaetae of body segment XVI; 7: metazonal warts of body segment XVI; 8: body segments XV and XVI, lateral view.

FIGURES 9–14.
Egonpretneria vudutschajldi
sp. n.
, paratype male from the Rođakuša Pit, Velebit Mt., anterior gonopods. 9: anterior view; 10: antero-lateral view; 11: lateral view; 12: posterior view; 13: postero-lateral view; 14: distal view. Designations: a : anterior shield-like coxal process, b : bristles apparatus, d : subapical latero-caudal denticle, l : lamella, lp : lateral process, pp : posterior process, sco : syncoxal rounded lobe.

subSubSection.paragraph: Walking legs: Elongated, with tuberculated coxae, trochanters, and basal parts of prefemora. Leg pairs 1 and 2 with tarsal combs; prefemora with several long and robust setae, femora and postfemora with groups of several long and robust setae.
Male sexual characters: Leg pairs 3–7 are the same size as the rest of the legs; without any peculiarities. Leg pairs 10 and 11 with coxal glands; no other peculiarities.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 15–18.
Egonpretneria vudutschajldi
sp. n.
, paratype male from the Rođakuša Pit, Velebit Mt., gonopods. 15: anterior gonopods, anterior view; 16: anterior gonopods, posterior view; 17: anterior gonopods, lateral view; 18: posterior gonopods, anterior view. Designations: a : anterior shield-like coxal process, b : bristles apparatus, d : subapical latero-caudal denticle, l : lamella, m : uniramous medial sternal process, v : posterior medial vesicle, lp : lateral process, pp : posterior process, lcp : lateral coxal process, sco : syncoxal rounded lobe. Scale line: 0.3 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Posterior gonopods (
Fig. 18
): With a short uniramous medial sternal process ( m ) [= Mittelfortsatz sensu
Strasser ( 1966 b)
or medial sternite process sensu
Mršić ( 1992 )
] and posterior medial vesicle ( v ). Lateral coxal processes ( lcp ) [= gonopodialen Seitenteile sensu
Strasser ( 1966 b)
or lateral sternite processes sensu
Mršić ( 1992 )
] are much higher than m ; apical halves with wide projections orientated antero-mesally.

Habitat. Vudu Čajld Pit is 86 m deep and has a simple morphology. The following troglobitic forms are recorded from the type locality:
Brachydesmus
sp. (Diplopoda);
Typhlotrechus bilimekii (Sturm, 1847 )
( Coleoptera ), and
Spelaeodromus pluto (Reitter, 1881 )
(also Coleoptera ).

Rođakuša Pit is a pit 35 m deep with a temperature of about 10 °C. The specimen was found under a stone at the bottom of the pit. Other inhabitans of the pit:
Neobisium
sp. ( Pseudoscorpiones );
Brachydesmus
sp. (Diplopoda); and
Redensekia likana kosiniensis Pretner, 1963
,
Typhlotrechus bilimekii kiesenwetteri (Schaum, 1862 )
, and
Catops
sp. (all Coleoptera ).
